name: Bayesian Reasoning Quality Rubric

criteria.name: Prior Quality
criteria.description: Prior is based on base rates and reference classes, not just intuition

scoring.1: No prior stated or purely intuitive guess
scoring.2: Prior stated but ignores base rates entirely
scoring.3: Prior considers base rates with some adjustment
scoring.4: Prior well-grounded in base rates with justified adjustments
scoring.5: Exceptional prior with multiple reference classes and clear reasoning

criteria.name: Likelihood Justification
criteria.description: Likelihoods P(E|H) and P(E|¬H) are estimated with clear reasoning

scoring.5: Exceptional likelihood estimates with empirical grounding or detailed reasoning

scoring.1: Evidence is not diagnostic at all (LR ≈ 1)

scoring.3: Calculation is correct with minor issues
scoring.5: Perfect calculation with both probability and odds forms shown

criteria.name: Calibration & Realism
criteria.description: Posterior is calibrated, not overconfident (avoids extremes without justification)

scoring.1: Posterior is 0% or 100% without extreme evidence
scoring.2: Posterior is very extreme (>95% or <5%) with weak evidence
scoring.3: Posterior is reasonable but might be slightly overconfident
scoring.5: Exceptional calibration with explicit confidence bounds

criteria.name: Assumption Transparency
criteria.description: Key assumptions and limitations are stated explicitly

scoring.5: Exceptional transparency with sensitivity analysis showing assumption impact

criteria.name: Base Rate Usage
criteria.description: Analysis uses base rates appropriately (avoids base rate neglect)

scoring.2: Acknowledges base rates but doesn't use them
scoring.4: Properly incorporates base rates with adjustments
scoring.5: Exceptional use of multiple base rates and reference classes

criteria.name: Sensitivity Analysis
criteria.description: Tests how sensitive conclusion is to input assumptions

scoring.3: Basic sensitivity analysis on key inputs
scoring.5: Exceptional sensitivity analysis showing robustness or fragility clearly

criteria.name: Interpretation Quality
criteria.description: Posterior is interpreted correctly with decision implications

scoring.3: Good interpretation with some decision guidance
scoring.4: Clear interpretation with actionable decision implications
scoring.5: Exceptional interpretation linking probability to specific actions and thresholds

criteria.name: Avoidance of Common Errors
criteria.description: Avoids prosecutor's fallacy, base rate neglect, and other Bayesian errors

scoring.1: Multiple major errors (confusing P(E|H) with P(H|E), ignoring base rates)
scoring.5: Exceptional awareness with explicit checks against common errors

thresholds.very_good: Average score ≥ 4.0 (most forecasts should aim for this)

stakes_guidance.low_stakes: Personal predictions, low-cost decisions: aim for ≥ 3.0
stakes_guidance.medium_stakes: Business decisions, moderate cost: aim for ≥ 3.5
stakes_guidance.high_stakes: Major decisions, high cost of error: aim for ≥ 4.0

usage_instructions: Rate each criterion on 1-5 scale. Calculate average. For important forecasts or decisions, minimum score is 3.5. For high-stakes decisions where cost of error is high, aim for ≥4.0. Check especially for base rate neglect, prosecutor's fallacy, and overconfidence - these are the most common errors.
